meanings.definition: To renounce or reject under oath
meanings.sent1: She had to foreswear her allegiance to the old king in court.
meanings.sent2: He was caught trying to foreswear his guilt during the trial.
meanings.sent3: The knight had to foreswear his loyalty to the evil sorcerer in a dramatic scene.
meanings.sent4: In the heat of the moment, she had to foreswear her promises to herself.
meanings.sent5: The decision to foreswear his past mistakes weighed heavily on his conscience.

meanings.definition: To swear falsely or commit perjury
meanings.sent1: The witness was asked not to foreswear during the testimony.
meanings.sent2: He chose to foreswear the truth to protect his friend.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child decided to foreswear about eating the cookies.
meanings.sent4: She didn't want to foreswear, but the fear made her do it.
meanings.sent5: The villain's plan was to foreswear his involvement in the crime.

meanings.definition: To give up or abstain from something
meanings.sent1: She had to foreswear sweets to stay healthy.
meanings.sent2: He decided to foreswear his bad habits for a better life.
meanings.sent3: The challenge was to foreswear social media for a week.
meanings.sent4: In order to succeed, he had to foreswear distractions and focus.
meanings.sent5: The monk's vow was to foreswear worldly possessions and live a simple life.
